page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: A typical dairy farm in this area on average will be approximately 100_120 acres in size.Many farms extend this by renting additional land which is available in the area.For example,one larger than average farm boosts its acreage to almost 250 acres by renting 80-100 extra acres of land. The average herd size is somewhere between 75-100 cows per farm.As is the case in most dairying areas of the British Isles,the herds have comprised mainly of British Friesians.Today, whilst this is still largely the case, more and more farmers are introducing the British Holstein into their herds. In fact,another favourite of the farmer's in this area is the Friesian- Holstein cross.This is,in the main, simply because of the high milk yields produced by these particular breeds.
